/wiki/Bear_River_6,_Nova_Scotia: Bear River 6 is a 649-hectare (1,600-acre) Mi'kmaq reserve located in Annapolis County and Digby County, Nova Scotia. It had a population of 138 individuals in 2016, an increase of 35.3% compared to 2011.
/wiki/Bear_River_First_Nation: Bear River First Nation (Mi'kmaq: L'sɨtkuk) is a Míkmaq First Nations band government located in both Annapolis County and Digby County, Nova Scotia. As of 2012, the Mi'kmaq population is 103 on-Reserve, and approximately 211 off-Reserve.
/wiki/Mi%27kmaq: The Miꞌkmaq or Miꞌgmaq (also Micmac, Lnu, Miꞌkmaw or Miꞌgmaw; English: /ˈmɪɡmɑː/; Miꞌkmaq: [miːɡmax]) are a First Nations people of the Northeastern Woodlands, indigenous to the areas now known as Canada's Atlantic Provinces and the Gaspé Peninsula of Quebec as well as the northeastern region of Maine. They call their national territory Miꞌkmaꞌki (or Miꞌgmaꞌgi). The nation has a population of about 170,000 (including 18,044 members in the recently formed Qalipu First Nation in Newfoundland), of whom nearly 11,000 speak Miꞌkmaq, an Eastern Algonquian language. Once written in Miꞌkmaq hieroglyphic writing, it is now written using most letters of the Latin alphabet.
/wiki/Bear_River,_Nova_Scotia: The village is adjacent to the Bear River First Nation which administers the Bear River 6, 6A and 6B reserves.
/wiki/Bear_River_6A,_Nova_Scotia: Bear River 6A is a 31.2ha Mi'kmaq reserve located in Annapolis County, Nova Scotia. It is administratively part of the Bear River First Nation.
/wiki/Bear_River_6B,_Nova_Scotia: Bear River 6B is a 24.3ha Mi'kmaq reserve located in Annapolis County, Nova Scotia. It has a population of 16 in 2016.
/wiki/Beaver_Lake_I.R._17,_Nova_Scotia: Beaver Lake 17 is a small Mi'kmaq reserve on the Eastern Shore of Nova Scotia, Canada, in the Halifax Regional Municipality. It is located on Route 224 about 21 km (13 mi) northwest of Sheet Harbour and about 20 km (12 mi) southeast of Upper Musquodoboit. The community is located adjacent to Lower Beaver Lake and is located within the community of Beaver Dam.
/wiki/Millbrook_First_Nation: The Millbrook First Nation is a Mi'kmaq First Nation band government in Nova Scotia, Canada.
/wiki/Boat_Harbour_West_37,_Nova_Scotia: Boat Harbour West 37 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Pictou County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Pictou_Landing_First_Nation: Pictou Landing First Nations is a Mi'kmaq First Nation band government in Nova Scotia, Canada. Their territory spans five reserves that have a combined area of 527.6 hectares (1,304 acres). As of September 2017, the Mi'kmaq population is 485 on their own reserve, 23 on other reserves and 157 living off-reserve.
/wiki/New_Glasgow,_Nova_Scotia: New Glasgow is a town in Pictou County, in the province of Nova Scotia, Canada. It is situated on the banks of the East River of Pictou, which flows into Pictou Harbour, a sub-basin of the Northumberland Strait.
/wiki/Cambridge_32,_Nova_Scotia: Annapolis Valley First Nation (formerly known as Cambridge 32) is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Kings County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Annapolis_Valley_First_Nation: Annapolis Valley First Nation is composed of two Mi'kmaq First Nation reserves located in southwestern Nova Scotia. As of 2017, the Mi'kmaq population is 119 on-Reserve, and approximately 173 off-Reserve for a total population of 292. The community has a gas bar, tobacco shop, gaming centre, health centre, and a chapel.  It is the second smallest First Nation community in Nova Scotia in terms of population.
/wiki/Mi%27kmaq_people: The Miꞌkmaq or Miꞌgmaq (also Micmac, Lnu, Miꞌkmaw or Miꞌgmaw; English: /ˈmɪɡmɑː/; Miꞌkmaq: [miːɡmax]) are a First Nations people of the Northeastern Woodlands, indigenous to the areas now known as Canada's Atlantic Provinces and the Gaspé Peninsula of Quebec as well as the northeastern region of Maine. They call their national territory Miꞌkmaꞌki (or Miꞌgmaꞌgi). The nation has a population of about 170,000 (including 18,044 members in the recently formed Qalipu First Nation in Newfoundland), of whom nearly 11,000 speak Miꞌkmaq, an Eastern Algonquian language. Once written in Miꞌkmaq hieroglyphic writing, it is now written using most letters of the Latin alphabet.
/wiki/Kentville,_Nova_Scotia: Kentville is a town in Kings County, Nova Scotia. It is one of the main towns in the Annapolis Valley, and it is the county seat of Kings County.  As of 2016, the town's population was 6,271.  Its census agglomeration is 26,222.
/wiki/Caribou_Marsh_29,_Nova_Scotia: Caribou Marsh 29 is a Mi'kmaq reserve in Cape Breton County, Nova Scotia, 8 kilometres (5.0 mi) southwest of Sydney.
/wiki/Membertou_First_Nation: The Membertou First Nation is a Mi'kmaq First Nation band government in the tribal district of Unama'ki, also known as Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia. As of 2012, the Mi'kmaq population is 814 on-Reserve, and approximately 481 off-Reserve. It operates a community radio station CJIJ-FM.
/wiki/Potlotek_First_Nation: Potlotek First Nation, also known as Chapel Island First Nation is a Mi'kmaw community in northeastern Nova Scotia. The community is situated on the Chapel Island 5 reserve on Chapel Island on the Bras d'Or Lakes. As of 2020, the First Nation has approximately 750 band members living on and off reserve.
/wiki/St._Peter%27s,_Nova_Scotia: St. Peter's (Scottish Gaelic: Baile Pheadair; formerly known as "Santo Pedro", "Saint-Pierre", "Port Toulouse", and "St. Peters") is a small incorporated village  located on Cape Breton Island in Richmond County, Nova Scotia, Canada.
/wiki/Cole_Harbour_30,_Nova_Scotia: Cole Harbour 30 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Nova Scotia, Canada, in the Halifax Regional Municipality.
/wiki/Cole_Harbour,_Nova_Scotia: Cole Harbour is a former unincorporated village and unincorporated community located in the Halifax Regional Municipality in Nova Scotia, Canada.
/wiki/Eskasoni_3,_Nova_Scotia: Eskasoni 3 (2016 population: 3,422) is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Cape Breton County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Eskasoni_First_Nation: The Eskasoni First Nation is a band government of the First Nations indigenous Mi'kmaq people located in Nova Scotia, Canada. As of 2012, the Mi'kmaq population is 4,440 on-Reserve, and 592 off-Reserve. It is the most populous band government in Nova Scotia and has its own community radio station, CICU-FM, broadcasting at 94.1 MHz. The Eskasoni First Nation is the home of the Unama'ki Institute of Natural Resources, a Mi'kmaq organization devoted to natural resources and the environment.
/wiki/Eskasoni_3A,_Nova_Scotia: Eskasoni 3A is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Cape Breton County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Fisher%27s_Grant_24,_Nova_Scotia: Fisher's Grant 24   is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Pictou County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Fisher%27s_Grant_24G,_Nova_Scotia: Fisher's Grant 24G   is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Pictou County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Franklin_Manor_22,_Nova_Scotia: Franklin Manor 22 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Cumberland County, Nova Scotia. It is administratively split between the Pictou Landing First Nation and the Paq'tnkek First Nation.
/wiki/Paq%27tnkek_First_Nation: Paq'tnkek First Nation (pronounced buck-n-keg) is a Mi'kmaq Band in northeastern Nova Scotia. Its populated reserve is Paqtnkek-Niktuek 23. As of December 2019 the total registered population was 598. It is a member of the Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq. The name Paqtnkek means “by the bay” or "Above the water (but at a distance from the ocean)". The area has long been important to Mi'kmaq for the fishing of eel and other species.
/wiki/Parrsboro,_Nova_Scotia: Parrsboro is a Canadian community located in Cumberland County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Glooscap_35,_Nova_Scotia: Glooscap 35 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Kings County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Glooscap_First_Nation: Glooscap First Nation is a Canadian Mi'kmaq aboriginal community located in both Kings County and Hants County, Nova Scotia. Also known as Kluskap, its reserve is located approximately 6.4 kilometres (4.0 mi) from the Town of Hantsport. Created in 1907 as Horton 35, the reserve encompasses some 171.1 hectares (423 acres) of rolling, mainly forested land. Forest management is practiced by the band. There is a variety store, gas bar, Greco Pizza, and gaming centre. There is also a health centre, youth centre and chapel. The Glooscap Landing Business Park is also owned by Glooscap First Nation which houses a second gas bar and Tim Hortons. The 2019 population was 391 people of whom approximately 100 lived on the reserve, making Glooscap the third-smallest First Nation community in Nova Scotia after Bear River First Nation and Annapolis Valley First Nation.
/wiki/Gold_River_21,_Nova_Scotia: Gold River 21 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Lunenburg County, Nova Scotia. The population was 77 in 2011.
/wiki/Acadia_First_Nation: The Acadia First Nation is composed of five Mi'kmaq First Nation reserves located in southwestern Nova Scotia. As of 2015, the Mi'kmaq population is 223 on-Reserve, and 1,288 off-Reserve. Acadia First Nation was founded in 1967 and covers the south shore area of Nova Scotia and Yarmouth County. The community runs multiple businesses including 5 gaming centres, 3 gas stations and 2 Rose Purdy centers
/wiki/Indian_Brook_Indian_Reserve_14,_No: Indian Brook 14 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Hants County, Nova Scotia. In the 2016 Census, the reserve has 1,089 residents.
/wiki/Shubenacadie_First_Nation: The Sipekne'katik First Nation is composed of four Mi'kmaq First Nation reserves located in central Nova Scotia. As of 2012, the Mi'kmaq population is 1,195 on-Reserve, and approximately 1,190 off-Reserve.  The First Nation includes   Indian Brook 14, Nova Scotia, near Shubenacadie, Nova Scotia. The band was known as the Shubenacadie First Nation until 2014 when the traditional spelling and pronunciation of its name was officially adopted.
/wiki/East_Hants,_Nova_Scotia: East Hants, officially named the Municipality of the District of East Hants, is a district municipality  in Hants County, Nova Scotia, Canada. Statistics Canada classifies the district municipality as a municipal district.
/wiki/Malagawatch_4,_Nova_Scotia: Malagawatch 4 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Inverness County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Chapel_Island_First_Nation: Potlotek First Nation, also known as Chapel Island First Nation is a Mi'kmaw community in northeastern Nova Scotia. The community is situated on the Chapel Island 5 reserve on Chapel Island on the Bras d'Or Lakes. As of 2020, the First Nation has approximately 750 band members living on and off reserve.
/wiki/Wagmatcook_First_Nation:
Wagmatcook First Nation is a band of Mi'kmaq people located in Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia. 
As of 2017, the registered population was 537 on their on reserve.
/wiki/Waycobah_First_Nation: Waycobah First Nation is composed of two Mi'kmaq Indian Reserves located in Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia. As of 2012, the Mi'kmaq population is 833 on-Reserve, and approximately 82 off-Reserve.
/wiki/Margaree_25,_Nova_Scotia: Margaree 25 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Inverness County, Nova Scotia.
/wiki/Medway_River_11,_Nova_Scotia: Medway River 11 is a Mi'kmaq reserve located in Queens County, Nova Scotia.
